description: Number of nodes with service status `critical` from those registered
Number of nodes with service status `passing` from those registered
Number of nodes
Number of nodes with service status `warning` from those registered
Number of nodes registered in the consul cluster
Total critical services on nodes
Total passing services on nodes
Total services registered on nodes
Total warning services on nodes
Metrics to count the number of services matching criteria like the service tag, the node name, or the status. To be queried using the `sum by` aggregator.
minimum latency from this node to all others
p25 latency from this node to all others
median latency from this node to all others
p75 latency from this node to all others
p90 latency from this node to all others
p95 latency from this node to all others
p99 latency from this node to all others
maximum latency from this node to all others
Number of peers in the peer set

[DogStatsD only] This metric counts the number of times the agent has performed failure detection on another agent at a slower probe rate. The agent uses its own health metric as an indicator to perform this action. (If its health score is low, means that the node is healthy, and vice versa.)
[DogStatsD only] The p95 for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.
[DogStatsD only] The avg for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.
[DogStatsD only] The number of samples of consul.memberlist.gossip
[DogStatsD only] The max for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.
[DogStatsD only] The median for the number of gossips (messages) broadcasted to a set of randomly selected nodes.

[DogStatsD only] This metric describes a node's perception of its own health based on how well it is meeting the soft real-time requirements of the protocol. This metric ranges from 0 to 8, where 0 indicates "totally healthy". For more details see section IV of the Lifeguard paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1707.00788.pdf
[DogStatsD only] This metric counts the number of alive agents, that the agent has mapped out so far, based on the message information given by the network layer.
[DogStatsD only] This metric counts the number of times an agent has marked another agent to be a dead node.
[DogStatsD only] Number of times an agent suspects another as failed while probing during gossip protocol
[DogStatsD only] This metric counts the number of alive agents, that the agent has mapped out so far, based on the message information given by the network layer.
[DogStatsD only] This metric gives the number of dead agents, that the agent has mapped out so far, based on the message information given by the network layer.
[DogStatsD only] The p95 for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select agent.
[DogStatsD only] The avg for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select agent.
[DogStatsD only] The number of samples of consul.memberlist.probenode
[DogStatsD only] The max for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select agent.
[DogStatsD only] The median for the time taken to perform a single round of failure detection on a select agent.
[DogStatsD only] The p95 for the number of agents that have exchanged state with this agent.
[DogStatsD only] The avg for the number of agents that have exchanged state with this agent.
[DogStatsD only] The number of samples of consul.memberlist.pushpullnode
[DogStatsD only] The max for the number of agents that have exchanged state with this agent.
[DogStatsD only] The median for the number of agents that have exchanged state with this agent.
[DogStatsD only] This metric counts the number of times an agent has accepted an incoming TCP stream connection.
[DogStatsD only] This metric counts the number of times an agent has initiated a push/pull sync with an other agent.
[DogStatsD only] This metric measures the total number of bytes sent by an agent through the TCP protocol
[DogStatsD only] This metric measures the total number of bytes sent/received by an agent through the UDP protocol.
[DogStatsD only] This metric measures the total number of bytes sent/received by an agent through the UDP protocol.

[DogStatsD only] This increments whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server. This gives a measure of how much a given agent is loading the Consul servers. Currently, this is only generated by agents in client mode, not Consul servers.
[DogStatsD only] Increments whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server and fails
[DogStatsD only] Age of the hosts file

[DogStatsD only] The p95 time for how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)

[DogStatsD only] The avg time for how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)
[DogStatsD only] The number of samples of consul.http.get.v1.kv..

[DogStatsD only] The max time for how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)

[DogStatsD only] The median time for how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)

[DogStatsD only] This tracks how long it takes to service the given HTTP request for the given verb and path. Paths do not include details like service or key names, for these an underscore will be present as a placeholder (eg. consul.http.GET.v1.kv._)

[DogStatsD only] This increments when an agent updates.

[DogStatsD only] This increments when an agent is marked dead. This can be an indicator of overloaded agents, network problems, or configuration errors where agents cannot connect to each other on the required ports.
[DogStatsD only] This increments when an agent leaves the cluster.
